result.execSummary:
The defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs and surcharges by 6/30/15.  If not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

superMiscConds.notes:
Undergo a drug treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tremaine Cortez Davis

received and filed from Ebonie, Leonard and  Willie Perteet, James Bayne, Burt Ladell, Randi Williams, Shatarra and Lakisha Bates. Gwendolyn and Curtis Davis, Berry and Destiny Hall.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Case adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-01-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-14-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 amended to Possession of Herion, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.41(3g)(am), a Felony.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.    Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-31-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 7.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 02-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for Denis Stingl for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 2-3-2015 and for jury trial on 2-18-2015 in Branch 7.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 02-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense motion to modify bail argued and denied by the Court. Bail: $5000.00 cash .
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 12-18-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis in custody.   Hanna Kolberg for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court denied defense motion and found there was probable cause for the stop.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Martin-MPD Officer.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #07CF4487 that are attached to the complaint.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.

Defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis in custody.  Karyn Behling for Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is reassigned to Judge Konkol due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Tremaine Cortez Davis in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
